Sing Out Loud Local Showcase: September 5 – 7
Colonial Oak Music Park
21 St George Street, St Augustine, FL, United States
The Local Artist Showcases are a cornerstone of the Sing Out Loud Festival experience, offering music fans an opportunity to explore Northeast Florida’s diverse and vibrant music scene. From indie rock and bluegrass to hip hop, country, spoken word and comedy, the lineup reflects the richness of talent found throughout the region. Improv Comedy Night – September 10
Colonial Oak Music Park
21 St George Street, St Augustine, FL, United States
Your First Coast Comedy veteran professionals have no plan and willingly dive headfirst into almost any challenge the audience will throw at them, resulting in unforgettably hilarious moments. And it gets better! This show is for everyone! You can bring the whole family because these improvisers play smart… to ensure the show is always clean and never mean! Pay-What-You-Will. All ...

Colonial Oak Music Park

Contact Us
Bull & Crown
53 St George St, St Augustine, FL 32084 ·
Built on the original site of a skilled Minorcan Carpender, Francisco Pellicer, our British-style pub offers delicious burgers, fish & chips, and wings. Enjoy craft cocktails and cold beer while watching the buzz of the town from our spacious front deck located on St. George St.
No Reservations
Email:
bullcrown@colonialquarter.com
View the Menu
Hours
Open Daily 11AM – 9PM
Taberna del Caballo
37 St George St, St Augustine, FL 32084
Enjoy some of the city’s best sangria at the “Tavern of the Horse,” our 18th century-style Spanish tavern in the heart of downtown St. Augustine.
No Reservations
Visit the Site
Hours
Sunday – Thursday 11AM – 9PM
Friday – Saturday 11AM – 10PM
Saint Augustine Seafood Company
33 St George St, St Augustine, FL 32084
St Augustine Seafood Company is a brand new fast casual seafood restaurant located in the heart of Saint Augustine’s historic district. Enjoy one of our signature fresh fish sandwiches, a golden fried shrimp basket, one of our hearty chowders or any of a number of great dishes from our locally inspired menu. Dine under our majestic oak while listening to live music or enjoy a full service experience in our beautiful bar/lounge. At St Augustine Seafood Company, you’re sure to catch a great meal and a great time!
No Reservations
View the Menu
Visit the Site
Hours
Sunday – Thursday 11AM-9PM
Friday – Saturday 11AM-10PM
St. Augustine Colonial Experience
43 St George St, St Augustine, FL 32084 ·
On the Living History Tour, you can imagine life in St. Augustine for hundreds of years. See and Experience how our citizens lived, worked and played while defending against attack. Learn about blacksmithing and cover your ears for a live musket demonstration! Visit a home that’s over 270 years old. Climb the watchtower and look for ships on the horizon. The St. Augustine Colonial Experience allows you to understand the success of the oldest permanent European Settlement in North America. History awaits you.
Visit the Page
Hours
Daily 10am – 5pm
Tour Times
10:30am · 12pm · 1:30pm · 3pm
Buy Tickets
Purchase tickets at 14 S Castillo Drive
For Group tickets please call 904-599-2113
St. Augustine Pirate & Treasure Museum
12 S Castillo Dr, St Augustine, FL 32084
The St. Augustine Pirate & Treasure Museum offers an exciting and educational museum experience that transports you and your family back in time over 300 years to Port Royal, Jamaica, at the height of the Golden Age of Piracy. Plan your visit today!
Visit the Site
Hours
Daily 10am – 7pm
Colonial Oak Music Park
27 St. George Street, St Augustine, FL 32084
The Colonial Oak Music Park is historic downtown St. Augustine’s most attractive and largest outdoor venue. The Oak’s enchanting ambiance is the host for free concerts, private parties, weddings, and talent shows.
View Upcoming Events
Visit the Page
Hours
Daily 10am – 7pm
General Contacts

Private Events
The Colonial Oak Music Park is a most enchanting St. Augustine setting for weddings, corporate events and other private parties. A regular host to community and private gatherings — The Oak features an amphitheater under St. Augustine's second oldest sweeping live oak tree with enough family-style table seating for up to 175 guests.
Our Oak space also features a full bar, and many different catered menu options from our on-site chef to please any crowd - we enjoy tailoring custom events to your needs!
Since the famous St. Augustine Pirate & Treasure Museum is also located on site we can even provide you with pirates or re-enactors from the colonial period to mingle and entertain your guests at a small additional fee.
In order to book your event, fill out the form below to get started. We can't wait to hear from you!

autumn@colonialquarter.com
